com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api.devices

Class WOWZAudioDevice

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.api.devices.WOWZAudioDevice
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    WOWZBroadcastAPI.AudioBroadcaster, WOWZBroadcastAPI.Broadcaster

    public class WOWZAudioDevice
extends java.lang.Object
implements WOWZBroadcastAPI.AudioBroadcaster
    Use the WOWZAudioDevice class to encode audio streams. The object wraps a media encoder running on a dedicated thread. The various control messages may be sent from arbitrary threads (typically the app UI thread). The encoder thread manages both sides of the encoder, feeding and draining.

    • Method Detail

      • getAudioSource

        public int getAudioSource()
        Gets the actively configured input device for capturing audio.
        Returns:
        An identifier for the active audio source. Possible values are listed at android.media.MediaRecorder.AudioSource.

      • setAudioSource

        public void setAudioSource(int audioSource)
        Sets the actively configured input device for capturing audio.
        Parameters:
        audioSource - An identifier for the active audio source. Possible values are listed at android.media.MediaRecorder.AudioSource. The default is MediaRecorder.AudioSource.CAMCORDER. This setting doesn't affect audio that's actively being captured. It has no effect until a new capture session starts. Setting this to an invalid value will cause an error to occur at the beginning of the session.

      • getSamplingConfig

        public WOWZBroadcastConfig getSamplingConfig()

        Returns:

      • isSamplingAudio

        public boolean isSamplingAudio()
        Checks whether audio samples are currently being read from the audio input device and passed along to sample listeners.
        Returns:
        True if audio samples are currently being read from the audio input device and passed along to sample listeners; false otherwise.

      • startAudioSampler

      • startAudioSampler

        public void startAudioSampler()

      • getBroadcastConfig

        public WOWZBroadcastConfig getBroadcastConfig()
        Description copied from interface: WOWZBroadcastAPI.Broadcaster
        Gets the configuration settings for an active broadcast session. Only returns a non-null value between calls to prepareForBroadcast() and stopBroadcasting().
        Specified by:
        getBroadcastConfig in interface WOWZBroadcastAPI.Broadcaster
        Returns:
        The configuration settings for the active broadcast session or the broadcast session currently being prepared.

      • prepareForBroadcast

        public com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.support.status.WOWZStatus prepareForBroadcast(WOWZBroadcastConfig broadcastConfig)
        Description copied from interface: WOWZBroadcastAPI.Broadcaster
        Initializes each component of a broadcast. Upon successful initialization, each component must set its status to WOWZState.READY or WOWZState.IDLE and also indicate the error in the status.
        Specified by:
        prepareForBroadcast in interface WOWZBroadcastAPI.Broadcaster
        Parameters:
        broadcastConfig - The broadcast configuration.
        Returns:
        The status after transitioning each broadcast component to WOWZState.READY.

      • startBroadcasting

        public com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.support.status.WOWZStatus startBroadcasting()
        Description copied from interface: WOWZBroadcastAPI.Broadcaster
        Called on each broadcast component to begin a live streaming broadcast. Upon success, each component must set its status to WOWZState.RUNNING or WOWZState.IDLE and also indicate the error in the status.
        Specified by:
        startBroadcasting in interface WOWZBroadcastAPI.Broadcaster
        Returns:
        The status after transitioning each broadcast component to WOWZState.RUNNING.

      • stopBroadcasting

        public com.wowza.gocoder.sdk.support.status.WOWZStatus stopBroadcasting()
        Description copied from interface: WOWZBroadcastAPI.Broadcaster
        Called on each broadcast component to end a live streaming broadcast. Upon success, each component must set its status to WOWZState.IDLE.
        Specified by:
        stopBroadcasting in interface WOWZBroadcastAPI.Broadcaster
        Returns:
        The status after transitioning each broadcast component to WOWZState.IDLE.
